reviews.comment:
"The only way two people keep a secret is if one of them is dead"
I enjoyed this page turner by the skillful Freida McFadden. The setting was perfect for this suspense filled read. I was invested in the characters enough to dislike and distrust most of them lol. That was the well executed goal. Speaking of executed... Some of the people in this book enjoyed it way too much.
I fell in love with the house where Ethan and Tricia were stranded during a storm. If the walls could talk... Oh wait!
By midway through I became disappointed because I thought I figured it all out, but glad to say I wasn't really even close.
The only negative thing I have to say is the stunning conclusion was almost too much all at once. But then I thought about real murder cases and realized it's plausible.
The epilogue delivers a neat "happy ending"... Or does it? Pick this one up and you'll be wondering about that for awhile. Another great read by Freida McFadden!
